summary: Gale Lynn Oppenberg was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided consist of payroll records and certification reports that detail her employment, position, and salary within the HSCA. Specifically, one document includes payroll authorization forms and a memo confirming her start date and salary. The other documents are certification reports listing HSCA employees, their positions, annual salaries, and gross pay for specific accounting periods. These documents span from December 1977 to December 1978, indicating her period of employment with the HSCA.
significance: Gale Lynn Oppenberg's significance lies in her employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), which was tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, her presence on payroll records and certification reports indicates she was a staff member involved in the HSCA's operations during its investigation.
